casebody.data:
Laurice Singleton v. The State. No. 23280. Delivered January 30, 1946.

The opinion states the case.

H. G. Woodruff and Jennings C. Brown, both of Decatur, for appellant. Ernest S. Goens, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. GRAVES, Judge.

Appellant was convicted in the district court of Wise County for the offense of murder, and assessed a penalty of five years in the penitentiary.

In the transcript forwarded to this court we find neither a judgment of conviction nor notice of appeal, in the absence of which this court is without jurisdiction to entertain the appeal. *126See McCallan v. State, 112 Tex. Cr. R. 173, 15 S. W. (2d) 1049, on necessity of judgment. On necessity of notice of appeal, see Art. 827, C. C. P., 1925, Vernon’s Ann. Tex. C. C. P., Vol. 3, and. cases cited thereunder.

The appeal is dismissed.
